javafx.scene.input

Class ClipboardContent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<DataFormat,java.lang.Object>
        • javafx.scene.input.ClipboardContent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<DataFormat,java.lang.Object>

    public class ClipboardContent
extends java.util.HashMap<DataFormat,java.lang.Object>
    Data container for Clipboard data. It can hold multiple data in several data formats.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClipboardContent

        public ClipboardContent()

    • Method Detail

      • hasString

        public final boolean hasString()
        Gets whether a plain text String (DataFormat.PLAIN_TEXT) has been registered on this Clipboard.
        Returns:
        true if hasContent(DataFormat.PLAIN_TEXT) returns true, false otherwise

      • putString

        public final boolean putString(java.lang.String s)
        Puts a plain text String onto the Clipboard. This is equivalent to invoking setContent(DataFormat.PLAIN_TEXT, s). Setting this value to null effectively clears it from the clipboard.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to place. This may be null.
        Returns:
        True if the string was successfully placed on the clipboard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if null reference is passed

      • getString

        public final java.lang.String getString()
        Gets the plain text String from the clipboard which had previously been registered. This is equivalent to invoking getContent(DataFormat.PLAIN_TEXT). If no such entry exists, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The String on the clipboard associated with DataFormat.PLAIN_TEXT, or null if there is not one.

      • hasUrl

        public final boolean hasUrl()
        Gets whether a url String (DataFormat.URL) has been registered on this Clipboard.
        Returns:
        true if hasContent(DataFormat.URL) returns true, false otherwise

      • putUrl

        public final boolean putUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Puts a URL String onto the Clipboard. This is equivalent to invoking setContent(DataFormat.URL, s). Setting this value to null effectively clears it from the clipboard.
        Parameters:
        url - The string to place. This may be null.
        Returns:
        True if the string was successfully placed on the clipboard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if null reference is passed

      • getUrl

        public final java.lang.String getUrl()
        Gets the URL String from the clipboard which had previously been registered. This is equivalent to invoking getContent(DataFormat.URL). If no such entry exists, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The String on the clipboard associated with DataFormat.URL, or null if there is not one.

        Gets whether an HTML text String (DataFormat.HTML) has been registered on this Clipboard.

        Returns:

      • hasRtf

        public final boolean hasRtf()
        Gets whether an RTF String (DataFormat.RTF) has been registered on this Clipboard.

        true if hasContent(DataFormat.RTF) returns true, false otherwise

      • putRtf

        public final boolean putRtf(java.lang.String rtf)

        public final java.lang.String getRtf()
        Gets the RTF text String from the clipboard which had previously been registered. This is equivalent to invoking getContent(DataFormat.RTF). If no such entry exists, null is returned.
        Returns:

      • hasImage

        public final boolean hasImage()
        Gets whether an Image (DataFormat.IMAGE) has been registered on this Clipboard.
        Returns:
        true if hasContent(DataFormat.IMAGE) returns true, false otherwise

      • putImage

        public final boolean putImage(Image i)
        Puts an Image onto the Clipboard. This is equivalent to invoking setContent(DataFormat.IMAGE, image). Setting this value to null effectively clears it from the clipboard. When an image is placed on the clipboard in this manner, an operating system dependent image is loaded onto the clipboard (such as TIFF on mac or DIB on Windows).
        Parameters:
        i - The image to place. This may be null.
        Returns:
        True if the image was successfully placed on the clipboard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if null reference is passed

      • getImage

        public final Image getImage()
        Gets the Image from the clipboard which had previously been registered. This is equivalent to invoking getContent(DataFormat.IMAGE). If no such entry exists, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The Image on the clipboard associated with DataFormat.IMAGE, or null if there is not one.

      • hasFiles

        public final boolean hasFiles()
        Gets whether an List of Files (DataFormat.FILES) has been registered on this Clipboard.
        Returns:
        true if hasContent(DataFormat.FILES) returns true, false otherwise

      • putFiles

        public final boolean putFiles(java.util.List<java.io.File> files)
        Puts an List of Files onto the Clipboard. This is equivalent to invoking setContent(DataFormat.FILES, files). Setting this value to null effectively clears it from the clipboard.
        Parameters:
        files - The files to place. This may be null.
        Returns:
        True if the files were successfully placed on the clipboard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if null reference is passed

      • putFilesByPath

        public final boolean putFilesByPath(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filePaths)
        Puts an List of Files onto the Clipboard, based on the file path. This is simply a convenience method which constructs a List of Files and invokes the putFiles(java.util.List) method.
        Parameters:
        filePaths - The files to place. This may be null.
        Returns:
        True if the files were successfully placed on the clipboard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if null reference is passed

      • getFiles

        public final java.util.List<java.io.File> getFiles()
        Gets the List of Files from the clipboard which had previously been registered. This is equivalent to invoking getContent(DataFormat.FILES). If no such entry exists, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The List of Files on the clipboard associated with DataFormat.FILES, or null if there is not one.
